value.title: Power BI and the On-premises Data Gateway: What is it?
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the On-Premises Data Gateway. What is it exactly? This can be used with more than just Power BI. This includes PowerApps, Microsoft Flow, Azure Analysis Services and more. The entire Power Platform!   If you found this video helpful, we have a free cheat sheet for you for more
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WJ5Y4FjkWZw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Apps for Consumers
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can use Power BI Apps as a consumer of dashboards and reports. Power BI Apps are the main way that dashboards and reports are distributed widely in your organization.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Power BI: Build a custom KPI scorecard
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how you can use Power BI to build a custom KPI scorecard. The key is the UNICHAR DAX function.  Demo files: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI reports for consumers (end users)
value.excerpt: Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports for consumers, or end users. This is geared towards someone not really familiar with the Power BI interface or how to use Power BI reports to their fullest.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to dynamically filter by today's date. Using a date table, you can create a DAX measure that can then be used as a Power BI report-level filter to dynamically filter by today's date within Power BI Desktop.be  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/lkHFpmA4SJ4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI: Use DAX to get relative dates
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can get relative dates, in Power BI Desktop, without using the relative date slicer or relative date filters. You just need to sprinkle a little DAX into Power BI Desktop to get this going!  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Power BI Walkthrough: Analysis Services Live Connect
value.excerpt: Adam walks through how to setup a live connection to Analysis Services, or Azure Analysis Services, in Power BI Desktop. This also involves getting things working with the On-Premises Data Gateway.  What is a gateway - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WJ5Y4FjkWZw Authentication with AS Live Connections

value.title: Take Power BI data alerts to the next level with Microsoft Flow
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you how easy it is to use Microsoft Flow to take Power BI data alerts to the next level. Use Microsoft Flow to send to additional people. value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/

value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful

value.title: Combine Multiple or All Sheets from an Excel File into a Power BI solution Using Power Query Dynamic
value.excerpt: Combining multiple files from one folder is already supported built-in through the graphical interface of Power Query when use you Get Data from Folder. However, if you have one Excel file, with multiple sheets with the same structure but different data, you cannot use that option. There is a very little

value.title: Conditional Column in Power BI using Power Query   You can do anything
value.excerpt: There are many scenarios that you might want to implement a conditional expression. When the conditional expression's logic is on a row-by-row basis, the best is doing it in Power Query rather than DAX (there are exceptions always), The Add Conditional Column in Power Query is a very helpful option,

value.title: Count of Unique Values DistinctCount in Power BI Through Power Query Group By Transformation
value.excerpt: You can have a distinct count calculation in multiple places in Power BI, through DAX code, using the Visual's aggregation on a field, or even in Power Query. If you are doing the distinct count in Power Query as part of a group by operation, however, the existing distinct count is for all columns in

value.title: Create a Table in Power BI using Enter Data and How to Edit it
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just need a new table with a few rows or columns to be added to your data model. One option to create that table is to use the Enter Data option in Power BI Desktop. In this article, Iâ€™ll explain how you can use it, and also; more important: How to edit the data of that table after creating

value.title: Create Customized Age Bins or Groups in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI has the built-in feature of creating binning for a numeric field such as age. However, the default binning will create bins of equal size. If you want to create bins of different sizes, then you need to create that as a custom column. Fortunately, Power Query has transformations that can help.

value.title: Relationship in Power BI with Multiple Columns
value.excerpt: You can create relationships in Power BI between tables. Relationships are useful for some functions to work across multiple tables and produce the result. Relationship between tables also makes visualization and report elements more efficient, because the result of selection in one chart can affect

value.title: Row Filtering in Power BI and Power Query   Remove Blank Rows Vs Remove Empty
value.excerpt: When you have blank values in your data table, you can use Power Query transformations to remove the row with blank values. There are two transformations that are used very often for this purpose: Remove Empty and Remove blank rows. These two transformations are not exactly the same. In this article,

value.excerpt: Power BI reports are highly interactive, If you select a column in a column chart other charts will be highlighted. value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
